txt.en: 'So Gandalf popped me in a sack and carried me off, did he?  I'll be sure to share that one with him later, he'll enjoy it to no end.'
'Hah! A series of secret dwarf-tunnels below Bag End!  Delightful, and not far off from the truth of the mysterious burrow I left there.  Have folks found that yet?'
'I got shipped off down the river in a barrel, did I? No mystery where the origins of that story came from. Can't say I would relish having to do that again!'
'Poor Holly and her pies!  She wouldn't appreciate having such aspersions spread around as to their quality.  I bet I can guess who's been spreading that rumour around!'
'... and hah! Part of the Riders of Roger, in the Company of Theon? Bless my boots, yes, that sounds like a fine retirement indeed.'
'Oh ho! Lovely! Soaring off through the sky with sparks streaming behind.  Delightfuly imaginative indeed!'
'... and then myself! The first hobbit Lore-master, travelling with Radagast himself! A terribly flattering story indeed, I must encourage the re-telling of that one!'
'Lady Galadriel is teaching me the techniques to growing the biggest tater the Shire has ever seen? I suspect she's got more pressing issues occupying her time, but it might not hurt to ask!'
'... and that's to be followed by a one act play, Where There's Smaug, There's Fire? I may just have to put my pen to paper in honour of such a fine rumour.'
'... and if that weren't enough, now I'm fighting evil in a mask and cape, roaming the Shire at night? Oh my, what will they come up with next?'
'... and then to have that followed with me! In a fake beard!  Living with the dwarves and stealing their scraps? Oh, oh my gracious and goodness.'
'... and oh deary me, I'm not sure I can find that sweet child a real dragon, but perhaps I can send her back a plush one in secret. Charming, simply charming.'
